trans-unit.source: Represents a wsa:EndpointReference element.
The wsa:EndpointReference element can be used in wst:OnBehalfOf and wp:AppliesTo elements inside of a wsp:RequestSecurityToken element to specify an endpoint reference.

Supports either the WS-Addressing standard schema namespace (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing) or the WS-Addressing 1.0 schema namespace (http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing) when reading.
On write only the WS-Addressing 1.0 namespace (http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing) is supported.
For more information about the wsa:EndpointReference element, see the Web Services Addressing â€“ Core specification.
For more information about its use in WS-Trust protocols, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference"></xref> class with the specified URI.
An absolute URI that specifies the address of the endpoint reference.
Initializes the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Uri"></xref> property.
uri is not an absolute URI.
uri is `null`.
Gets a collection of the XML elements that are contained in the endpoint reference.
The wsa:Address element is not included in the collection.
The collection contains all of the child elements of the wsa:EndpointReference element except the wsa:Address element.
The collection is populated by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.ReadFrom%2A> method.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Uri%2A> property contains the value of the wsa:Address element.
A collection of the XML elements that are contained in the endpoint reference.
Reads a wsa:EndpointReference element from the specified XML dictionary reader.
See the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.ReadFrom%2A> overload topic for details.
The XML dictionary reader from which to read the endpoint reference.
The endpoint reference read from the XML dictionary reader or `null` if the wsa:EndpointReference element cannot be read.
Reads a wsa:EndpointReference element from the specified XML reader.
See the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.ReadFrom%2A> overload topic for details.
The XML reader from which to read the endpoint reference.
The endpoint reference read from the XML dictionary reader or `null` if the wsa:EndpointReference element cannot be read.
Gets the URI that specifies the address of the endpoint reference.
Represents the contents of the wsa:Address child element of the wsa:EndpointReference element.
The address of the endpoint reference.
Writes the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference"></xref> as a <wsa:EndpointReference> element to the specified XML writer.
Only supports writing the WS-Addressing 1.0 standard schema namespace (http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing).

The wsa:Address element is written first with the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Uri%2A> property, then the other elements specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Details%2A> collection are written.
The XML writer to which to write the endpoint reference.
